name: Sugared Cranberries
author: nch
summary: Sugared fresh cranberries taste sour on the inside and sweet on the outside. Serve them in a glass bowl as a Christmas snack or stick them on toothpicks and poke them into an apple as a fun Christmas decoration.
ingredients: 1 cup sugar, plus extra for coating
directions: Heat sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until the sugar has dissolved, about 3 minutes
Remove syrup from heat and allow to cool until lukewarm
Add cranberries to syrup and carefully stir to coat
Cover and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight
Sprinkle a baking sheet with sugar and line a second baking sheet with parchment paper
Drain cranberries well and spread out onto the sugar-covered baking sheet
Roll in the sugar and transfer cranberries to the parchment-lined baking sheet in a single layer
